scenario:
Air Products' (APD) shares declined by 13.2% in December due to administrative matters rather than end markets or operational issues. The decline is a result of a war of words between Air Products' management and activist hedge fund Mantle Ridge, which owns 1.8% of the company's stock. Mantle Ridge is seeking to restructure the board and replace CEO Seifi Ghasemi with industry veteran Eduardo Menezes. 

Mantle Ridge proposed four independent candidates to the board, including former Praxair CEO Dennis Reilley, and filed a proxy statement urging investors to vote for its nominees at the annual general meeting (AGM) scheduled for January 23. Air Products' board of directors responded by criticizing Mantle Ridge's track record, citing three successive settlements and significant underperformance of the stocks afterward. The board also disputed the qualifications of Mantle Ridge's proposed nominees.

Both parties have issued investor presentations highlighting their strategies for the company, setting the stage for an ongoing battle for shareholders' hearts and minds in January. The outcome of the AGM on January 23 will determine the future of Air Products' management and board composition.
